text:
Here at ElectroRoute, we're a renewables
focused energy trading company

and our mission is to make
net zero our reality.

We work with our clients and
our counterparties to help them

navigate all the commercial requirements
of the decarbonized energy economy.

We trade with renewable assets,
such as wind farms, solar farms,

and batteries here in Ireland,
across Europe and indeed across the world,

even as far away as Japan.
Our trading for these renewable assets

helps ensure that these assets get built
and ultimately deliver the carbon

free energy system that the world
so desperately needs to mitigate
against climate change.

We needed a product solution
that was scalable,

that allowed us to grow rapidly,
that allowed our developers and our IT

team to support the infrastructure,
the growing infrastructure of the company
in an agile and a cost effective way.
One of the core elements

of our business
is that we're a 24/7 trading business.

The energy markets
and the energy system is needed 24/7

around the clock,
wind farms and solar farms and batteries

provide power 24/7 around the clock
so it was essential that our

IT infrastructure was robust
and supported our 24/7 trading activities.

For us having that resilience and robustness
in our system was really, really important.

We don't have the big legacy
infrastructure that other companies in

our sector have and we see that provides us
with a real competitive advantage.

Our IT team really liked the solutions
provided by AWS

and we're deploying a full range
of products and solutions

developed by AWS across
all of our enterprise.

I think it's fair to say for us,
it's nearly an existential issue,

our business wouldn't have been able
to grow as rapidly across,

all of our different markets
and product lines and activities

if it wasn't for the scalability,
the flexibility,

and agility of our IT platform
through the AWS infrastructure.
